content.question: Which of the following best describes Alfred Weberâ€™s analysis of location decisions?

choices.label: It seeks to evaluate the impact of a single factor of production on location.
It seeks to minimize costs among multiple inputs of production.
It is applicable only in postindustrial economies with predictable spatial patterns.
It depends on the availability of a single node, link, and input of production.
It is applicable only in industrial economies with predictable spatial patterns.

content.answer: It seeks to minimize costs among multiple inputs of production.

unit.text: 7: Industrial and Economic Development Patterns and Processes

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Describe geographic concepts, processes, models, and theories.
